required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine how multifocal contact lens correction affects symptoms of discomfort and asthenopia in a group of myopic contact lens wearers in the non-presbyopic age range (ages 30-40 years).

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine how multifocal contact lenses affect contact lens comfort in non-presbyopic contact lens wearers. Current soft contact lens wearers who have symptoms of discomfort in their contact lenses will be recruited. Each subject (n = 84) will wear a single vision soft contact lens (Ultra single vision spherical lens) for two weeks and a low add power multifocal (Ultra for Presbyopia) for two weeks. Half of the subjects will wear the single vision lens first, and half of the subjects will wear the multifocal lens first. Initial lens group will be chosen randomly. Subjects will complete surveys that assess their vision and comfort which each lens, and ocular surface and accommodative/binocular vision status will be evaluated at the initial dispense and after wearing each lens for two weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Contact Lens Dry Eye Questionnaire-8 (CLDEQ-8) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 2 weeks of contact lens wear with each study lens (single vision and multifocal)
primary_outcome.description: After wearing each lens type (single vision and multifocal) for 2 weeks, subjects will complete the CLDEQ-8, a survey that assesses symptoms of contact lens discomfort, to reports their symptoms of discomfort with each lens type. CLDEQ-8 scores with the multifocal will be compared to CLDEQ-8 scores of the single vision lens and the subjects' habitual contact lenses to determine if the multifocal improved comfort. Min-Max CLDEQ-8 range: 0-37 points Higher point values indicate more/worse symptoms

arm_group.description: Subjects in this group will receive the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lens for the second two weeks.Therefore, this group will receive both study interventions.

Subjects in this group will receive the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lenses for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the second two weeks. Therefore, this group will receive both study interventions.

intervention.description: The multifocal contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) will be worn for two weeks
The single vision contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) will be worn for two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Visual acuity of 20/25 or better in both eyes with habitual contact lenses
- -0.75 D or more myopic in both eyes
- -0.75 D or less astigmatism in both eyes
- Current single vision contact lens wearer who does not require a reading aid
- CLDEQ-8 score of 12 or more points with habitual contact lenses
- No history of ocular surgery or medication
- Reports digital device use of at least 3 hours per day
- No significant signs of dry eye (grade 1 or less ocular surface staining, Schirmer score of 7 mm or more, and tear break up time of 7 seconds or more in bother eyes)
- No significant binocular vision disorders in both eyes (eso or exophoria of 4 prism diopters or less at distance and near, near point of convergence of 6 mm or less, no history of strabismus or patching)

facility.name: The Ohio State University College of Optometry

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical Research Optometrist and PhD Candidate

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Single Vision First
group.description: Subjects in this group will receive the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lens for the second two weeks. Single Vision First, Multifocal Second: The single vision contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) will be worn for two weeks first, then the multifocal contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) will be worn for two weeks

group.title: Multifocal First
group.description: Subjects in this group will receive the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lenses for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the second two weeks. Multifocal First, Single Vision Second: The multifocal contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) will be worn for two weeks first, then the single vision contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) will be worn for two weeks

group.title: Single Vision First
group.description: Subjects in this group will receive the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lens for the second two weeks. Single Vision First, Multifocal Second: The single vision contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) will be worn for two weeks first, then the multifocal contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) will be worn for two weeks

group.title: Multifocal First
group.description: Subjects in this group will receive the multifocal (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lenses for the first two weeks and be crossed over to the single vision spherical (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for the second two weeks. Multifocal First, Single Vision Second: The multifocal contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) will be worn for two weeks first, then the single vision contact lens (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) will be worn for two weeks

class.title: Race/Ethnicity Data Not Collected for This Study

measure.title: Contact Len Dry Eye Questionnaire-8 (CLDEQ-8) Score with Habitual Contact Lenses
measure.description: Min-Max range: 0-37 points Higher point values indicate more/worse symptoms

measure.title: Accommodative Lag with 2 Diopter Target
measure.description: Accommodative Lag was measured with an autorefractor while the the subject was viewing a visual target at at 50 cm (2 diopter visual demand) and the single vision study lens. Accommdative lag is reported with the single vision lens only because the multifocal lens induces power changes that affect autorefractor measurements.

measure.title: Accommodative Lag with 4 Diopter Target
measure.description: Accommodative Lag was measured with an autorefractor while the the subject was viewing a visual target at at 25 cm (4 diopter visual demand) and the single vision study lens. Accommdative lag is reported with the single vision lens only because the multifocal lens induces power changes that affect autorefractor measurements.

outcome.title: Contact Lens Dry Eye Questionnaire-8 (CLDEQ-8) Score
outcome.description: After wearing each lens type (single vision and multifocal) for 2 weeks, subjects will complete the CLDEQ-8, a survey that assesses symptoms of contact lens discomfort, to reports their symptoms of discomfort with each lens type. CLDEQ-8 scores with the multifocal will be compared to CLDEQ-8 scores of the single vision lens and the subjects' habitual contact lenses to determine if the multifocal improved comfort. Min-Max CLDEQ-8 range: 0-37 points Higher point values indicate more/worse symptoms
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after 2 weeks of contact lens wear with each study lens (single vision and multifocal)

group.title: CLDEQ-8 With Multifocal Contact Lens
group.description: Mean CLDEQ-8 score across both groups (single vision first and multifocal first)(n = 84) with the multifocal contact lens

group.title: CLDEQ-8 With Single Vision Contact Lens
group.description: Mean CLDEQ-8 score across both groups treatment groups (single vision first and multifocal first)(n = 84) with the single vision contact lens

group.title: CLDEQ-8 With Habitual Contact Lenses
group.description: Mean CLDEQ-8 score across both groups (single vision first and multifocal first)(n=84) at baseline with each subject's habitual contact lenses

measure.title: Contact Lens Dry Eye Questionnaire-8 (CLDEQ-8) Score
measure.description: After wearing each lens type (single vision and multifocal) for 2 weeks, subjects will complete the CLDEQ-8, a survey that assesses symptoms of contact lens discomfort, to reports their symptoms of discomfort with each lens type. CLDEQ-8 scores with the multifocal will be compared to CLDEQ-8 scores of the single vision lens and the subjects' habitual contact lenses to determine if the multifocal improved comfort. Min-Max CLDEQ-8 range: 0-37 points Higher point values indicate more/worse symptoms

analysis.groups_desc: Generalized linear models (controlling for repeated measures) of crossover analyses was run to compare mean CLDEQ-8 scores with habitual, multifocal, and single vision contact lenses (controlling for order)
analysis.p_value_desc: Results of post-hoc analyses comparing scores of each lens type to one another: Habitual lens and multifocal contact lens: p <0.001 Habitual lens and single vision lens: p <0.001 Multifocal lens and single vision lens: p = 0.08

analysis.groups_desc: A generalized linear model was run to determine if there was an interaction between lens type (single vision or multifocal) and refractive error (continuous, mean binocular spherical equivalent)
analysis.p_value_desc: Analysis controlled for order, visit, and repeated measures.

analysis.groups_desc: A generalized linear model was run to determine if there was an interaction between magnitude in accommodative lag (measured in diopters with a 2 diopter visual target) and lens type (single vision or multifocal)
analysis.p_value_desc: Analysis controlled for order, visit, and repeated measures.

analysis.groups_desc: A generalized linear model was run to determine if there was an interaction between lens type (single vision or multifocal) and age (continuous, measured in self-reported years)
analysis.p_value_desc: Analysis controlled for order, visit, and repeated measures.

analysis.groups_desc: A generalized linear model was run to determine if there was an interaction between lens type (single vision or multifocal) and age (measured categorically as 30 to <35 years old and 35 to 40 years old, by self report)
analysis.p_value_desc: Analysis controlled for order, visit, and repeated measures
analysis.other_analysis_desc: Post-Hoc Testing comparing CLDEQ-8 scores and the interaction between lens type and age group (denoted by lens type*age group) produced the following results: p = 0.01 for MF*<35 age group compared to Single Vision (SV)*<35 age group p = 0.07 for MF*<35 age group compared to MF*>35 age group p > 0.05 for MF*<35 age group compared to Single Vision (SV)*>35 age group p > 0.05 for SV*<35 age group compared to SV*>35 age group p >0.05 for SV*<35 age group compared to MF*>35 age group p > 0.05 for MF*>35 age group compared to SV*>25 age group

reported_events.time_frame: Data from potential adverse events were collected for the duration of the study for each subject. From baseline to final visit, each subject participated in the study for approximately 4-6 weeks.

group.title: Single Vision Contact Lens
group.description: All subjects wore the single vision (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA®) lens for approximately 2 weeks during the study.

group.title: Multifocal Contact Lens
group.description: All subjects wore the multifocal vision (Bausch + Lomb ULTRA® for Presbyopia) lens for approximately 2 weeks during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Marshall B. Ketchum University (The Ohio State University during study data collection)
